sections.content: **Hint:** Use filters or create a custom view to find this information quickly.
Think about a real-world scenario where your business would need to capture information through a web form. Would you be capturing Leads or Contacts? What's the purpose of the form?
Your Task: Create a webform that meets these requirements:

items: Apply some customization (color, font, or formatting)
Configure the form so you can easily identify which records came from it (think about Lead Source values, hidden fields, or campaign tags)
Test your form â€” have 5 classmates submit it to make sure it works

sections.content: **Publishing Option:** If you have a Zoho Sites page set up, try embedding your webform there.
Activity 3: Updating Leads with an Import
Your instructor will provide you with an import update file. Use this file to update your existing Leads.
After your update is complete, answer the following questions:

items: How many Leads now have "Webform Signup" in the Lead Source field?
How many Leads still have "Social Media" in the Lead Source field?
What specific social platforms now appear in the Lead Source field instead of "Social Media"?
What changed between your first import and this update?
Why is "Facebook" or "Twitter" more useful than just "Social Media"?
When would you use a bulk import versus a webform to get leads into your CRM?
Why does specific, consistent data in fields like Lead Source matter?
How can filters and custom views help you work smarter?
